intro: Lasiosiphon gilbertae, commonly known as Gilbert's lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other vines. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
